text:
Hi community,
I'm trying to insert raw HTML into an email using a personalized token. However, it is being rendered as plain text, not HTML. This is similar to the issue discussed in this <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YH119N2/p1694795440582729|thread>, but I haven't found a solution. For my use case, I want to insert HTML generated by an AI Assistant in the middle of the email. I've tried different approaches, such as a custom module and HTML templates, but none of them worked. I might have made some mistakes. I would appreciate any help. (I have searched on slack and on the web without much luck.)

:wave: Hello,

I would like to create a landing page template. The template will contain a form module, and I would like the landing page to look just like when sharing a HubSpot form (e.g. <http://share.hsforms.com/|share.hsforms.com/>). Is there a way in the landing page template to import/inherit the same styles used on the pages <http://share.hsforms.com|share.hsforms.com>?
When I add the same form to a landing page, I get no styles:
It was the personalisation token! Thank you so much!

Hello Guys,
I'm trying to create a module with the programmable email feature enabled, and I can't access some variables, like `{{ contact.HubSpot_owner_id }}`, or `{{ contact.company }}` or getting in which lists the user is part of.
Am I missing something ? `HubSpot_owner_id.email` is working whend used as a personalization token. I need to make conditionnal render based on the owners email like `{% if contact.HubSpot_owner_id.email == "corin@..." %}`

Hello everyone!it appears that I cannot use the newer range syntax for media queries within {% scope_css %} blocks. (<https://css-tricks.com/the-new-css-media-query-range-syntax>)

If I do, I get an error: "Invalid usage of scope_css: css could not be parsed"

Replacing with the older syntax (ie max-width, etc) will instead work without issue.

Is this the expected behavior?

This is working within the Design Manager on a module.
EDIT: What I mean is I am doing the work and seeing the bug within Design Manger.

Hello! I want to create like a blog but “academy” where it have a listing page with the articles, normally; but then, in the single page, it shows a video that when clicked the user should have to fill up a form first, as a lead, and then the video can be displayed.

What do you suggest to apply it using cookies and hubl?
sounds like membership would be a good fit for this
I wanted to be able to select the form using the form module and for the form to have the same styling as it would when displayed on share.hsforms link. I have raw HTML disabled for the form.

Hey <@U077R95N3KJ>. The idea is great and totally right but it seems that this template is missing any CSS files that are responsible for the look&feel. So without the CSS the form will never look the same way like in the preview and most likely never will since the preview is the HubSpot specific one and you want your form to be in your companys look&feel

Have you tried one of the default themes like growth?

If you're new to HS Development and want to create your own theme(and templates)I highly recommend you to:
• do the <https://academy.HubSpot.com/courses/cms-for-developers|HubSpot CMS for developer Certification> first
• Start with the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/themes/HubSpot-cms-boilerplate|CMS boilerplate theme>
• Add the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/key-concepts|developer docs> to your bookmarks. Those docs are pure gold
• Also - if you haven't already - check out the <https://community.HubSpot.com/|HubSpot community> for more resources and possible help
